title: Tiramisu Classico
description: The ultimate Italian dessert - layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and whipped mascarpone cream, dusted with cocoa powder.
instructions: Brew strong espresso and let cool completely. Mix with Marsala wine and rum if using.
Separate eggs. Beat egg yolks with 100g sugar until pale, thick, and ribbon-like, about 5 minutes.
Add mascarpone to yolk mixture and beat until smooth. Mix in vanilla extract.
In clean bowl with clean beaters, whip egg whites with pinch of salt until soft peaks form.
In another bowl, whip heavy cream with remaining 20g sugar until medium peaks.
Gently fold whipped cream into mascarpone mixture, then fold in egg whites until just combined.
Quickly dip ladyfingers in coffee mixture (1-2 seconds per side) and arrange in single layer in 9x13 inch dish.
Spread half mascarpone cream over ladyfingers, smoothing top.
Create second layer of dipped ladyfingers, then remaining cream.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, preferably overnight.
Before serving, sift cocoa powder generously over top and sprinkle with grated chocolate.
Use sharp knife dipped in hot water to cut clean portions.
